intro: Aster chrysophyllus, commonly known as the golden-leaf aster, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. The blooming period occurs in late summer to early autumn, adding vibrant color to the landscape during the transitional seasons.
